definitions.definition: The act of standing .
A defensive position or effort .
examples: The Commander says we will make our stand here.

definitions.definition: A resolute , unwavering position; firm opinion ; action for a purpose in the face of opposition .
examples: They took a firm stand against copyright infringement.

definitions.definition: A period of performance in a given location or venue .
examples: They have a four-game stand at home against the Yankees. They spent the summer touring giving 4 one-night stands a week.

definitions.definition: A device to hold something upright or aloft .
examples: He set the music upon the stand and began to play. an umbrella stand ; a hat- stand

definitions.definition: The platform on which a witness testifies in court ; the witness stand or witness box .
examples: She took the stand and quietly answered questions.

definitions.definition: ( historical ) An area of raised seating for waiters at the stock exchange .
A particular grove or other group of trees or shrubs.
examples: This stand of pines is older than the one next to it.

definitions.definition: ( forestry ) A contiguous group of trees sufficiently uniform in age-class distribution, composition, and structure, and growing on a site of sufficiently uniform quality, to be a distinguishable unit.
A standstill , a motionless state, as of someone confused, or a hunting dog who has found game.
A small building, booth , or stage , as in a bandstand or hamburger stand.
A designated spot where someone or something may stand or wait.
( US , dated ) The situation of a shop, store, hotel, etc.
examples: a good, bad, or convenient stand for business

definitions.definition: ( US , historical ) Ellipsis of tavern stand ( “ a roadside inn ” ) .
( sports ) Grandstand . ( often in the plural )
( cricket ) A partnership .
( military , plural often stand ) A single set , as of arms .
( obsolete ) Rank; post; station; standing.
( dated ) A state of perplexity or embarrassment .
examples: to be at a stand what to do

definitions.definition: A young tree , usually reserved when other trees are cut; also, a tree growing or standing upon its own root, in distinction from one produced from a scion set in a stock , either of the same or another kind of tree.
A location or position where one may stand.
( advertising ) An advertisement filling an entire billboard , comprising many sheets of paper.

definitions.definition: A container which stands upright , such as a barrel or cask .
A weight of from two hundred and fifty to three hundred pounds, used in weighing pitch .

main_definition: ( US , Scotland , dated ) A container which stands upright , such as a barrel or cask .
secondary_definitions: ( obsolete ) A weight of from two hundred and fifty to three hundred pounds, used in weighing pitch .
